definition: lit. severe floods and fierce beasts (idiom)/fig. great scourges/extremely dangerous or threatening things
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: A person that does not get online, often inspect a network to be great scourges .
sentences.chinese: 一個從來不上網的人，常常視網絡爲洪水猛獸。

sentences.english: Top-down discrimination, such as a scourge, was out of control.
sentences.chinese: 自上而下的歧視如洪水猛獸，一發不可收拾。

sentences.english: They are human beings, not a scourge and the god of plague.
sentences.chinese: 他們也是人，並非洪水猛獸和瘟神。

definition: to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to counter every move/to be full of tricks
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
to turn a blind eye to
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to shoot without aim (idiom); fig. to speak without thinking/firing blindly/to shoot in the air/a shot in the dark
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
